name: Epic Battle Fantasy 3
description: Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is a silly turn-based JRPG, full of useless NPCs, rabid cats, childish humor, unreasonably large weapons, anime boobs, and other nonsense. And it's totally free!

reviews.review_text: Wonderful game, the graphics may not be for everyone but it is 6 years old and is still just as enjoyable The game is full of references to other games and objects and the music I find to be amazing  Pros  - Lovely music - Tattled enemies carry over to other save-files/even if you die - Have to think of which gear/skills are best or each boss - Starter gear is still useful late-game   Cons  - GAME OVER screen is painfully slow at fading out to the main-menu - Heavy defense & high attackers half-way through   6 years old or not, play the game. It is free so all you have to lose if your time but isn't that what games are for now days.

I found EBF3 to be a light and adorable old-timey style rpg with a good sense of humor. Gameplay should be familiar to anyone with Jrpg experience, and many of the jokes refer to classic titles. Plenty of 'quests' on which you can go, and lots of achievements to unlock. I enjoyed the soundtrack very much. Found the enemy-strengthening curve to be not what I expected and at first a bit annoying, but in retrospect I thought it was appropriate and provided a good challenge.  Only possible downsides in my opinion are length of play and replayability. I prefer to be casual with my gaming these days, and this provided a weeked of cute, nostalgic fun. You can pick it up and put it down at your own pace since you can save anywhere. If you want something a little longer and more involved this may not be your favorite. Not sure if it will have much replay value, but completely worth a free download.

EDIT (1) : I just played a decent ammount of hours in this version on EPIC difficulty. My review will change and reflect on that. EDIT (2) : Updated the 'VERDICT' to suit the current build. EDIT (3) : Small changes.  NOTE: This review was made for the build 1.1.1.   Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is a parody game and a sequel to the Epic Battle Fantasy series. It's possibly one of the best FREE indie RPG turn-based games out there since it won several indie awards from sites like Armour Games. (Even though it is a little out-datted from Matt's standards) This version has small improvements such as an added the wave counter, status damage color, and other little changes around the game.  PROS: + Incredible Soundtrack (They don't very well though) + Unique and fun equipment system (No equipment is leftout) + Choose your battles (No random battles) + Humorous (Funny text here and there) + Several hours of gameplay and much content (15 hours average to completion) + Good Replay Value (Many difficulties & New Game+) + Several popculture references (From video games to shows) + Optional Exploration (Hidden loot) + Several Unlockable Extras (NPC Maker and other Art) + Optional Sidequests (Not necessary to beat them)  'Meh': * Visuals (Some are low quality while others are pretty) * Story (Nothing special, but not bad either) * Few grammar/spelling errors (Not really noticable) * Minigames (They were a hit and miss really) * Puzzles (Nothing special)  CONS: - Random difficulty spikes (Monoliths...) - Framerate issues (Won't run on a potato)  VERDICT: Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is overall an amazing game and personally a favorite of mine. The series continues to get better and better as each installment is added. Can't wait till EBF5! 8/10  P.S. I don't have the money to get Epic Battle Fantasy 4 or Bullet Heaven 2... It'd be great to play the Steam version of those games. ; - ;

5/5 Awesome game, and I recommend it to everyone and anyone who likes RPGs!  I actually started the EBF series on EBF 4 (which everyone should buy and play, because it's even better than this game), but have since played and/or beaten all of Matt's games, EBF or not. I still need to clear out the monsters in the last hidden area, but other than grinding to do that, I've beaten this game.  It's a fun, easy, colorful, and well-designed RPG with catchy music and a 'free' price tag to boot. There's lots of stupid humor, immature jokes here and there, and adorable monsters to smack for loots 'n' levels. And to make things even better, he's added a bunch of useful features that were not there on the web version! I absolutely adore the frame rate buttons, and I love that we can now see monster stats at any time during your turn. And Lance doesn't die so much! Woo! The difficulty is well-scaled so even newbies can play and beat it on lower difficulties, while the Epic difficulty can cause you to actual plan your fights and not be impossible!  So what's not to like? As far as I'm concerned, there is nothing horrible about EBF3, though there are a few bad things. The game doesn't look nearly as nice on full screen as EBF4 an BH2 do, but it still looks pretty good. There are a few spelling errors here and there, but nothing major. Plus, you likely won't use several of your equips, but what RPG doesn't have equips you never use? My biggest problem, though, is definitely trying to sell items and having to click 100+ times to get rid of all the bug wings I've collected.
